meanings.definition: Of or pertaining to a marriage between a person of high rank and a person of lower rank, in which the latter does not share the title or inheritance of the former.
meanings.sent1: The morganatic union between the prince and the commoner was not recognized by the royal family.
meanings.sent2: Their morganatic marriage caused a stir in the aristocratic circles.
meanings.sent3: The morganatic wedding led to some humorous misunderstandings among the nobility.
meanings.sent4: Their morganatic relationship was like a forbidden love story from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The concept of morganatic marriage was explained through a simple analogy in the history class.

meanings.definition: A marriage between a person of high rank and a person of lower rank, in which the latter does not share the title or inheritance of the former.
meanings.sent1: The king's morganatic with a commoner caused a scandal in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The morganatic of the duke and the maid was kept secret from the public.
meanings.sent3: The morganatic between the count and the servant was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: Their morganatic was a tale of love that defied social norms.
meanings.sent5: The history book explained the concept of morganatic in a clear and engaging manner.
